update.description:
Issues #402 and #1834

Undo / redo:

* Inserting simple shape links

* Inserting custom DAE links

* Inserting custom SVG links

* Copy/pasting links

* Deleting links with the DEL key

* Deleting links via context menu

Also fixes issue #1834. Once this is merged I can backport the fix to `gazebo7`.

Issue #1861: The tests only pass if you run them one by one. They have been disabled on Jenkins.

~~~
    ./test/integration/INTEGRATION_model_editor_undo LinkInsertionByMouse
~~~

~~~
   ./test/integration/INTEGRATION_model_editor_undo LinkDeletionByContextMenu
~~~
update.title: Model Editor: Undo insert / delete links

content.raw:
found workaround - comment out `gazebo::gui::stop` in QTestFixture.cc

Another problem: `g_*Act` gets deleted when MainWindow is destroyed but since `MEUserCmdManager` is a singleton it stays alive between tests and will have invalid `g_*Act`
content.html:
found workaround - comment out gazebo::gui::stop in QTestFixture.cc

Another problem: g_*Act gets deleted when MainWindow is destroyed but since MEUserCmdManager is a singleton it stays alive between tests and will have invalid g_*Act

pull_request.title: Model Editor: Undo insert / delete links

pullrequest.title: Model Editor: Undo insert / delete links

content.raw: I looked into the issue with running the tests one after another and for this integration test. I think there is a problem with `QMenu::exec` - it shows up and immediately disappears (when context menu call is invoked) that's why `TriggerDelete` wasn't able to find it.
content.html: I looked into the issue with running the tests one after another and for this integration test. I think there is a problem with QMenu::exec - it shows up and immediately disappears (when context menu call is invoked) that's why TriggerDelete wasn't able to find it.

content.raw:
I think I had played a bit with this before. If I remember well, the problem is that once we're registering commands for joint deletion, we want to do that before registering the link deletion.

In any case, I'll try doing it the way you said for now, and when the joints come we can see if there's a less repetitive way of doing it.
content.html:
I think I had played a bit with this before. If I remember well, the problem is that once we're registering commands for joint deletion, we want to do that before registering the link deletion.

In any case, I'll try doing it the way you said for now, and when the joints come we can see if there's a less repetitive way of doing it.

content.raw:
Yeah the name got kinda weird here. This function is analogous to [UserCmdHistory::OnStatsSlot](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/9569d26d280c2b01ff670497211fee28211b161e/gazebo/gui/UserCmdHistory.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#UserCmdHistory.cc-163) which is a callback for `~/user_cmd_stats`. That's where the name came from.

I'll change it to just `Update` if that's ok.
content.html:
Yeah the name got kinda weird here. This function is analogous to UserCmdHistory::OnStatsSlot which is a callback for ~/user_cmd_stats. That's where the name came from.

I'll change it to just Update if that's ok.

content.html:
it is possible to reuse the RemoveEntity function just to minimize duplicate code?

maybe something like:

  auto link = this->allLinks.find(_entity);
  if (link != this->allLinks.end())
  {
    auto cmd = MEUserCmdManager::Instance()->NewCmd(
        "Delete [" + link->second->GetName() + "]", MEUserCmd::DELETING_LINK);
    cmd->SetSDF(link->second->linkSDF);
    cmd->SetScopedName(link->second->linkVisual->GetName());
  }

  this->RemoveEntity(_entity);

haven't tested this, just an idea
